answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found some links that may help answer your question.
The document below is a detailed plan of the City of Wauwatosa’s economic development structure and implementation. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/102046/City_of_Wauwatosa_Economic_Development_Vision_Structure_and_Implementation_Plan 
I have also included a report done by the Area Economic Development Commission of Alexandria, MN. The document shows how the commission is organized and who runs the board.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301239/2009_Alexandria_MN_Area_Economic_Development_Commission_Report 
ICMA also sells a book entitled, “Management Policies in Local Government Finance”. It includes information about managing economic development and government finance decision making.
http://bookstore.icma.org/PreviewPacks/pp43063.pdf 
For another example of economic development systems you can visit the site below which includes a full list of what type of structures each county in Maryland uses.
http://www.msa.md.gov/msa/mdmanual/01glance/html/economicdevloc.html 
Additionally, for more examples the link below has a list of economic development departments from all over the country. It also includes information about job positions and the structure of those departments.
http://www.mrsc.org/Subjects/Econ/ed-organizing.aspx#Advisory
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

answers.author: Eugene Lauer

Thanks so much Ali.


Thanks so much Ali.

author: Eugene Lauer
text:
We are formulating recommendations for a new economic development structure in the County. Currently, we have a small transitional office. Does anyone have any thoughts based on his or her experiences as to what would constitiute their "ideal structure" (e.g., non-profit EDC; stand alone County dept; ED function a division blended into the Planning/Development dept or the like; an authority; etc)? Also, what mix of occupations/talents/company reps. would you have on an ideal advisory board or governing board?
Thanks.
title: Economic Development Organizations
